summary: An FBI 302 form documenting an interview with Natalie M. Joseph, who was hired for security on Little St. James island. She describes her hiring process through Michael Turnball and her duties securing the docks, noting she had never met Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Natalie M. Joseph
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI regarding her employment for security on Little St. James island. She was hired through Michael Turnball and worked securing the docks.

persons.name: Michael Turnball
persons.context: Person Natalie Joseph contacted about a security job on Little St. James, as recommended by a friend.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Owner of Little St. James island, mentioned as someone Joseph had never met or seen on St. Thomas.

connections.description: Joseph contacted Turnball about a security job opening on Little St. James and was hired, starting work on August 12, 2019.
Joseph worked security on Epstein's private island, Little St. James, though she stated she had never met him.

events.title: FBI interview of Natalie Joseph
events.description: FBI agents interviewed Natalie M. Joseph on Little St. James island regarding her security employment there.

events.title: Joseph's first day of work
events.description: Natalie Joseph began working security on Little St. James, tasked with securing the docks to prevent unauthorized access.

events.title: Joseph contacts Turnball
events.description: Natalie Joseph called Michael Turnball to inquire about a security job opening on Little St. James.

keyFacts: Natalie M. Joseph was hired for security on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, starting August 12, 2019.
Joseph was referred to the job by a friend and contacted Michael Turnball to secure the position.
Joseph's primary duty was securing the docks to prevent tourists or unauthorized persons from coming onto the island.
Joseph stated she had never met Jeffrey Epstein nor seen him on St. Thomas prior to her employment.
The FBI interview was conducted on Little St. James island as part of an investigation, documented in an FD-302 form.
